segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā campāyaṃ viharati gaggarāya pokkharaṇiyā tīre.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Campā on the banks of the Gaggarā Lotus Pond.

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā vāhano yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā vāhano bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then Venerable Bāhuna went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:

segments.pli: “katihi nu kho, bhante, dhammehi tathāgato nissaṭo visaṃyutto vippamutto vimariyādīkatena cetasā viharatī”ti?
segments.en: “Sir, how many things has the Realized One escaped from, so that he lives unattached, liberated, his mind free of limits?”

segments.pli: “Dasahi kho, vāhana, dhammehi tathāgato nissaṭo visaṃyutto vippamutto vimariyādīkatena cetasā viharati.
segments.en: “Bāhuna, the Realized One has escaped from ten things, so that he lives unattached, liberated, his mind free of limits.

segments.pli: Rūpena kho, vāhana, tathāgato nissaṭo visaṃyutto vippamutto vimariyādīkatena cetasā viharati,
kilesehi kho, vāhana, tathāgato nissaṭo visaṃyutto vippamutto vimariyādīkatena cetasā viharati.
Seyyathāpi, vāhana, uppalaṃ vā padumaṃ vā puṇḍarīkaṃ vā udake jātaṃ udake saṃvaḍḍhaṃ udakā paccuggamma ṭhitaṃ anupalittaṃ udakena;
segments.en: Suppose there was a blue water lily, or a pink or white lotus. Though it sprouted and grew in the water, it would rise up above the water and stand with no water clinging to it.

segments.pli: evamevaṃ kho, vāhana, imehi dasahi dhammehi tathāgato nissaṭo visaṃyutto vippamutto vimariyādīkatena cetasā viharatī”ti.
segments.en: In the same way, the Realized One has escaped from ten things, so that he lives unattached, liberated, his mind free of limits.”

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying near Campā…

suttaplex.blurb: Giving up ten things, the Buddha lives free of limits.
